tumor_size_max_dimension_evidence: Tumor size: 4.5 x 4.1 x 3.5 cm (Gross Description)
pT_evidence: Tumor size: 4.5 cm diameter, and the tumor grossly comes to within 1 mm of the visceral pleural surface but not directly involving it (Gross Description)
pN_evidence: No metastatic carcinoma identified (0/7 total) in lymph nodes (Light Microscopy)
tumor_stage_evidence: Based on AJCC7 criteria, pT is estimated as T2a and pN as N0
histologic_diagnosis_stated: Adenocarcinoma, poorly differentiated, with focal papillary architecture
histologic_diagnosis_evidence: Tumor histologic type (WHO classification): adenocarcinoma, with focal papillary features (Light Microscopy)
comment: The pathology report describes a lung adenocarcinoma in the right upper lobe, with a tumor size of 4.5 cm diameter and no lymph node metastasis. The tumor stage is estimated as Stage IB based on AJCC7 criteria.
